title: LeBron James shows support for Giants’ Odell Beckham Jr. | Giants Wire
text:
By: Kevin Hickey | 8 hours ago 
New York Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. and Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James, two of the most talked about players in the entire sports world, share a commonality when it comes to being scrutinized. Related: WATCH: Giants' Eli Manning masterfully trolls Skip Bayless 
Both athletes are top talents in their respective sports and have developed a friendship over the years. Being in New York, Beckham Jr.’s spotlight is amplified and James knows a thing or two about being at the center of the media. 
As someone who currently is and has been where Beckham Jr. is in terms of prominence, James offers to help his friend any way he can. 
“I just try to be a guidance to him and give him words of advice when he needs it and when he wants it,” James told Dan Duggan of NJ Advance Media on Saturday . “He can reach out to me any time no matter what time or what the subject is and I just try to give him a piece of my knowledge. It’s up to him however he wants to take it.” 
James, 32, is a bit older than Beckham Jr., 24, but the former has been in the spotlight since the Cavaliers drafted him first overall in the 2003 NBA Draft. Whether good or bad, James is one of the most, if not the most, talked about player in the NBA. 
The two stars got together in July 2016 to train together after James beat the Golden State Warriors in the Finals to earn his third championship and have kept in touch. A photo posted by Odell Beckham Jr (@obj) on Jul 22, 2016 at 7:48am PDT 
James, who has seen his share of criticism, has learned how to handle it by focusing on only what he can control. Related: Janoris Jenkins urges Giants to bring back JPP, keep defense together 
“At the end of the day, you control what you can control,” James said. “What I can control is how I approach the game, what I represent to the game and how I step out on the floor and compete every night with my teammates. That’s the only thing I can worry about and should focus on.”
